Ask HN: What is the coding exercise you use to explore a new language?
text: What is a good sample program or project to work on to explore the primary aspects of a programming language? Something that can be worked on for a couple hours or days. Something that will give exposure to most of the basics of a particular language. Would love to know how people go about trying out a new language in this way.

Ask HN: Cloud certifications and job prospects. Is there a real connection?
text:
As I'm getting a bit old (mid 40s) I'm thinking about getting an AWS certification in order to bump up my employability and better my standing in job market.

I'm wondering though if there's any tangible connection between the two. What has been your experience with these and similar certifications?

Ask HN: Did you notice an uptick of flame/rage bait in FB “Suggested for you”?
text:
In last few weeks I am seeing a lot of "Suggested for you" content on my Facebook wall that comes from pages I don't follow which can be best described as a flamebait. Those pages can be described as "anti-left" and "anti-woke" content and posts from them appearing on my timeline fall into either of those groups:

    - People of color casted for originally white characters.
    - Out of context left/progressive politician or activist quotes.
    - Photos of people in kink gear from pride parades.
    - Photos of trans/non conforming people who have problems passing or drag queens presented as trans people.
Each of those posts are accumulating dozens of thousands of interactions on them, be it reactions or comments.

I'm not following any pages that produce content like this, neither I am visiting websites like this and this doesn't even match my views, so I am puzzled. Is this "bottom of the barrel" attempt by Facebook to increase user engagement by exploiting their outrage at things?

I am the only one? Is it a fluke or a trend by Facebook?
